Articles.Content:
[KSPBlender](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/111483-KSPBlender-Blender-addon-for-importing-craft-files)--Blender .craft importer.

With Blender, it is possible to export 3D models to a 3D printer. And now, your craft can become readable, printable models, thanks to Dasoccerguy, a brand-new member of the forum!

Zekes' Life Size Space Shuttle in Blender:

![xPJNhvB.png](http://i.imgur.com/xPJNhvB.png)

This is soon to be printed. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

A little bit complicated to get working, but once you do, it is worth it.

![wD5fZYb.png](http://i.imgur.com/wD5fZYb.png)
I can see my bank account taking a hit... ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
I wonder how crafts made from multiple parts jury rigged together to make a shape would be printed.

Very nice! But the shuttle certanly is a nightmare.....

I don"t 3d print, I build by hand, tho.
Wow, i would love to have one of those hanging from my roof.

Thanks for the heads-up - and thanks to Dasoccerguy for the mod, of course.

If it's easy/easier to get models into Blender, does that make [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/111317-Showing-us-all-the-new-things-in-a-cooler-way](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/111317-Showing-us-all-the-new-things-in-a-cooler-way) only one step (export to SketchFab)?

So, I can get pretty much anything printed?

Step 1: Take a whole multi-stage ship

Step 2: Explode with Kronal Vessel Viewer (or offset everything by hand if you are a masochist)

Step 3: Force save (or save if you like leather and chains)

Step 3.5: Do the thing

Step 4: Print

Step 5: Paint them part up

Step 6: Assemble all the parts with transparent holders and put it all in a showcase [(something like this)](http://www.catalogs.com/info/bestof/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/Exploded-view-for-trade-show-300x199.jpg)

P.S. You could also print up each parts as individual projects and assemble them...

**Edited <time datetime="2015-02-24T04:47:22Z" title="02/24/2015 04:47  AM" data-short="9 yr">February 24, 2015</time> by Axelord FTW**

> 
> So, I can get pretty much anything printed?
> Step 1: Take a whole multi-stage ship
> 
> Step 2: Explode with Kronal Vessel Viewer (or offset everything by hand if you are a masochist)
> 
> Step 3: Force save (or save if you like leather and chains)
> 
> Step 3.5: Do the thing
> 
> Step 4: Print
> 
> Step 5: Paint them part up
> 
> Step 6: Assemble all the parts with transparent holders and put it all in a showcase [(something like this)](http://www.catalogs.com/info/bestof/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/Exploded-view-for-trade-show-300x199.jpg)
> 
> P.S. You could also print up each parts as individual projects and assemble them...

Um.... yes.... or you can just put it in blender and then export it to a 3d printer-friendly mode. My friend said he can print my shuttle in one piece, I'm working on that right now (as soon as i solve the stupid boolean joins)

EDIT Can we 3-D print a hype train for this?

Ooooh, amazing! I wonder how the prints would look like..

**Edited <time datetime="2015-02-24T14:07:57Z" title="02/24/2015 02:07  PM" data-short="9 yr">February 24, 2015</time> by Columbia**

wellllllll this is pretty awesome. =D

combined with the Kerbals you can already get from Shapeways, I sense a Mun Landing diorama in my future.

Important - can it handle mod parts?

> 
> Important - can it handle mod parts?

Not yet, though it should be relatively simple to write a KSP plugin that writes the part names and the directories in the format the program uses.

> 
> Not yet, though it should be relatively simple to write a KSP plugin that writes the part names and the directories in the format the program uses.

Understood - so I won't be printing my Mun lander any time soon (the only irreplaceable mod part is a 2.5m procedural fairing base ring right smack in the middle of the craft, kind of hard to get around that =P) But it looks like tons of fun either way.

Awesome id love a copy of all of these, i can see me spending some money lol
